summary: Robert C Morrison was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from 1977 to 1978. These documents list his name, position, annual salary, and gross pay for various accounting periods. The documents do not provide specific details about his role within the HSCA or his involvement in the JFK assassination investigation, but they confirm his employment during the committee's active period.
significance: Robert C Morrison's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, indicating his involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll and certification reports confirms his participation in the committee's activities.
